name: Banaras (Varanasi)
summary: Banaras, one of the oldest cities in the world, is a spiritual hub of India. Known for its ghats along the River Ganges, it attracts pilgrims from all over the world.

name: Vaishno Devi (Katra)
famous_temples: Vaishno Devi Temple, Bhairavnath Temple, Ardhkuwari Temple
summary: Vaishno Devi is one of the most revered pilgrimage sites in India, located in the Trikuta Mountains. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Vaishno Devi, and millions of devotees visit every year.

name: Vrindavan
famous_temples: Banke Bihari Temple, ISKCON Vrindavan, Prem Mandir, Radha Raman Temple, Madan Mohan Temple
summary: Vrindavan is a sacred town known for its association with Lord Krishna's early life. It's famous for its beautiful temples and the vibrant Holi festival.

name: Mathura
summary: Mathura, the birthplace of Lord Krishna, is a major Hindu pilgrimage site. The Krishna Janmasthan Temple complex attracts visitors from across the world.

name: Ujjain
famous_temples: Mahakaleshwar Temple, Kal Bhairav Temple, Harsiddhi Temple, Chintaman Ganesh Temple, Mangalnath Temple
summary: Ujjain is one of the seven sacred cities in Hinduism, famous for the Mahakaleshwar Temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. The city also hosts the Kumbh Mela every 12 years.

name: Khatoo Shyam
summary: Khatoo Shyam is a small village in Rajasthan known for the temple of Shyam Baba, who is believed to be an incarnation of Barbarika, a character from the Mahabharata.

name: Taj Mahal (Agra)
summary: The Taj Mahal, an iconic symbol of love, is a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of the Seven Wonders of the World. Built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan, it attracts millions of visitors annually.

name: Kurukshetra
famous_temples: Brahma Sarovar, Sthaneshwar Mahadev Temple, Bhadrakali Temple
summary: Kurukshetra is the legendary site of the great battle of the Mahabharata. It is a sacred place for Hindus, famous for the Brahma Sarovar and various other historical and religious sites.

name: Haridwar
famous_temples: Har Ki Pauri, Mansa Devi Temple, Chandi Devi Temple, Maya Devi Temple,RishiKesh
summary: Haridwar is one of the holiest cities in India, where the Ganges River flows. It's known for its ghats, especially Har Ki Pauri, where devotees take a dip to wash away sins.
